poem:
Title: Ode to Dion's Determination

In the melody of her body, a discordant note,
A symphony of strength now the fight's new quote.
Rigid and raw, yet a voice unwavering - 
From the nerve's cruel song, brave star suffering.
"No halting symposium of myself," she sings,
Against stiff marionette strings,
A resilient hymn Dion rings,
Over life's cruel whims and things.
